intro: Sarga angusta, commonly known as the narrowleaf sarga, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Sarga angusta is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to thrive in coastal and semi-arid environments. Its botanical features make it a valuable plant for ecological studies and traditional herbal uses.
